|wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR5112A;AR5112A-00, CN4623.00C, 3104, KOREA; |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abg |wi1_ant_conn=none |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Kendin |eth_chip2_model=KS8721B;KS8721B, 0442A4 GDF7823; |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=4.5 to 6GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5506;MSC, 5506, 436GR;1;InGaP/GaAs HBT;16-pin MLPQ; ,,, 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5510;MSC, 5510, 442FE;1;InGaP/GaAs HBT;16-pin MLPQ;3 mm x 3 mm; |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os=ThreadX;G4.0.4.0; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.30 |default_user=admin |default_pass= |oui=00:13:46 |oui_eth=00:13:46 }} {{SupportPage|vendor=D-Link|model=DGL-3420}} "WL AP 2554 RA1" and "HW Rev A3" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
"WL AP 2554 RA1-B10" and "Rev V1.0" is silkscreened on (at least one) production model board. ==Firmware notes== *The firmware is compressed with arj *OS: ThreadX JADE/Green Hills Version G4.0.4.0 *ar531x, 3.0.1.12, 18:00, 08 Dec, 2004, Build 1048 (dgl3420_firmware_100.bin) ==Serial== ===Pinout=== It's on the back of the unit, presumably. Tx seems to be the large used pad next to the two large grounded pads - both of which are somewhat below the power connector. The output doesn't appear to be particularly useful.. [http://www.dd-wrt.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=637894&sid=bc09ec3ce1ea32cefedf27cd172771fa a trait] [http://users.atw.hu/balubati/website_files/surecom/surecom.html which may] [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=14205 be shared with] other '''Global Sun''' AR231x + ThreadX devices.. ===Boot log=== 
aaa
bbb
EZ
==Probable used PSU(s)== The power supply which seems to be bundled with US sold units looks to be a '''JENTEC''' JTA0302A. The connector is smaller than usual.. {{hasPowerSupply |brand=JENTEC |model=JTA0302A |input_v=100-120 |input_a=0.5 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=5 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |manuf_country=China |style=small, straight }} __NOTOC__
